lines.text: [Reading unrehearsed lines off the TelePrompTer]

[as Maggie]
Dr. Randall, what a surprise! Are you having lunch here?

[as Dr. Randall]
I will if it's that sample. Huh... I wish it was that simple.

[offstage]
This guy never heard of contact lenses?

[as Dr. Randall]
The test results have come back.

[as Maggie]
And?

[as Dr. Randall]
And I'm afraid the results are very disturbing. It seems that Angelique has a rare case of brake fluid...
[pause]
Bran... fluid. Bran flavor.
What the hell?

[offstage]
Brain fever!

[offstage, loudly]
Say it!

[as Maggie]
Brain fever!

[as Dr. Randall]
Yes. Brain fever. Or what we call in Austria...
[they both goggle at the word]
Kopfgeschlagen. At the current rate of inflation, her brain will laterally explore the...

[as Maggie]
Literally explode?

[as Dr. Randall]
Exactly, within the next three houses.

[as Maggie]
Hours?

[as Dr. Randall]
Yes, will literally explode within next three hours. I would suggest leaving the restraint.

[as Maggie]
Restaurant?

[as Dr. Randall]
Restaurant, yes.

[as Maggie]
Her brain will actually explode?

[as Dr. Randall]
Yes, yes, I've, um, seen it happen. It's a dreadful, dreadful thug. Thing.
You have beautiful eyes.
Ooh, they're nothing compared to my tits.

[accepting an award]
Ohhh, there's so many people to thank. First of all, my fabulous supporting cast, who gives a new meaning to the word "support"...
[At their table]
Bitch!
Hag!
I hate her so much!

[as Lori, Celeste, And Jeffrey kiss and make up]
WAIT! Wait! But I'm carrying his child!

[annoyed]
I didn't sleep with her! Will somebody please believe me!
[Ariel and Rose enter as doctors]
Doctor!
A second opinion...
[Celeste mouths to Rose asking what she's doing]
...this is Dr. Frans Blau of the sex change clinic in Bethesda, Maryland.

Thank you. Dr. Randall, after extensive investigations, I've come to the conclusion that it's virtually impossible for you to have impregnated your nurse - Montana Moorehead - because before she came to our little clinic, she was... Milton Moorehead of Syosset, Long Island. Hello!
[Rose opens the high school yearbook showing Montana's teenage boy photo]

[shouts and runs off]
NO! NO! NO!
[to her male costar]
Next time, could you wear a swimsuit underneath the towel? It's a little early in the day for me.
[walks off]
I can't act in a swimsuit.
I know...
David! David! David, David, David, David, David!
Hey, great scene with Bolt.
I realize I'm not a young woman; however...
What do you mean, you're not...
...could you PLEASE point out to our new costume designer
[grabs her]
whose name I don't quite have yet...
Tawny Miller, Miss Talbert.
How do you do.
[to David]

[to Tawny]
You're fired.
Oh God.
I'm just kidding.
[into PA system]
no turbans for Miss Talbert!
Actors don't like to play coma. They feel it limits their range.
I never said I was the best mother in the world. Give me a little credit, will you, credit for being someone who tried... to love you the only way she knew how?
I know that speech.
You do?
Yeah, it was the, uh, the Thanksgiving show, when Maggie meets Bolt's blind nephew.
[offstage - watching the monitor as it is revealed on live TV that Montana is a man]
She's a boy!
[long, incredulous pause]
Yeah, well we *knew* that.
[starts gagging]
Are you okay?

[weak voice]
I'm fine. I'm just going to go congratulate the others.
One more date we would've had a Greek tragedy on our hands.
There's a nurse in the restaurant. Did I miss a meeting?
Of course I'm an egomaniac! I have America's Sweetheart climbing up my drainpipe!
Yes. Yes. Yes. I AM guilty. Guilty of love in the first degree.
Celeste, I want to act!
Don't say that, "I want to act", ever, please!

I would like to voice my strong concern about this show's spiraling decline in ratings. David, ever since you took us to the Caribbean, it's been Jamaica homeless people sucking soup, and a big wave outside that cost a hundred thousand dollars. That's depressing and it's expensive, two words I hate. You know the words I like? I like the word "peppy" and the word "cheap". Peppy and cheap.

[after seeing Lori on People magazine]
YOU - promised me you would get rid of Celeste. WE WERE BOTH NAKED AND YOU PROMISED! NAKED!
Hey! We were never naked.
Well, we could've been! Not only did you get rid of Celeste but you - YOU CREATED LORI! This ingénue from HELL! She has more lines than I do and she's a GOD... DAMN... MUTE!

[watching the live episode unfold]
At last, DRAMA!
Of course I can kiss her!
This is ridiculous! I can kiss who I want!
No! You can't! You can't kiss her!
Why because she's *your* neice?

[shouts]
No, you nitwit! Because she's my daughter! And your daughter.
What?
What are you talking about?
We're her parents! *You* and I!
[sobbing]
We're her Mommy and her Daddy.

[about Lori Craven]
She has more lines than I do and she's a GOD DAMN MUTE!
Get rid of Celeste and Mr Fuzzy is yours.

[bursting into David's office]
We need to talk. Look, I don't care WHAT Tawny Miller says. This hat makes me look like the GOD damned Tweety Bird.
[to Montana]
Do you mind?
You, you're asking me to leave?
That's right. I'm asking you to leave.
David...
Miss Moorehead, may Miss Craven and I have a moment alone, please?
No problem. I'm a professional. I do things professionally.
[storms out]

[from off stage]
I hate you! I hate you, you pig!
She's got a lot of spirit.
She's a deranged bitch!
Don't call me Mr. Loman! My name is Anderson! Anderson! ANDERSON!
I was under orders.
So - was - Hitler! Oh, no, I don't mean Hitler, I mean the other guy, the other one.
Himmler.
No, no, no.
Hess.
Eichmann.
Eichmann.
[an audition]
Very, very good, Mark. And very true. I love what you're doing. I just, I think if we could try it one more time, and this time... I don't know... maybe try one without your shirt.
Sure.
[Removes it and reviews the script]
"Will you be having wine with dinner?"

[lustily]
I think we've found our waiter!
What I feel like is Gloria effing Swanson. I'm 42 yrs old, I don't want to be dressed like a dead woman."
Hi. Uh, I'm Lori Craven and... I'm an actress.
An actress! Really! How nice for you! I'm Betsy Faye Sharon and I'm a bitch. Now get out of here.
Listen, she just won her 8th Schmenger, right? Edmund's crazy about her. She's got a lot of juice.
Well, that's when you dump people, okay? When they're still on top, before they lose their popularity and drag the show down with them.
[Explaining his proposal for a one-man Hamlet play]
it's all happening in Hamlet's head. So you only need one actor.
She came in yesterday. I don't know who the hell she is. Her name is Naven, Maven, Slaven... Claven... there's no agent.
Find her.
Well, what if she can't act?
That never stopped us before!
[Barnes snaps his fingers]
What?

[snap, snap, snap, snap, snap]
We make her mute!
What?
what could be more pathetic? God, I'm good.
She's been through hell, and we're her family. So in this crisis, we have to support her.
Yeah.
We have to love her.
Mmm.
We have to care about her.
Mmm.
And we have to milk it for every drop of publicity we can get.
Oh, I'll tell you why I'm here! I'm here because... I... I...
Come on, say it! "I want you, Jeffery. I'm consumed with jealousy for my neice, because I want you."
Oh, please!
Admit it, you have feelings for me.
My feelings are ABOUT you, not FOR you. There's a big difference!
Even for an actor, you're an egomaniac!

The guy was killed in an auto accident! I looked it up! He was driving in the Yukon, in a pink convertible, to visit his brother who's an ex-con named Frances, when a tractor trailer comes along and decapitates him. You know what that mean, it means he doesn't have a head. How am I suppose to write for a guy who doesn't have a head? He's got no lips, no vocal cords. What do you want me to do?
Sudden speech, the last sign of brain fever. She could blow at any moment!
Why, Bolt! I didn't realize you were here.
Well... I am.
You speak beautifully for a mute.
I'm not a genius. I'm just a working actress.
No, no, no, doing dinner theatre is horrible. Doing hemorrhoid commercials is horrible. What you did... there are no words for!
You know, I'd think you were acting, but you've never been this good.
I'm looking at crawdad butts, cover 'em up!

[to David]
What kind of moron are you?
Get out!

[crying]
Please try to understand what I am going through.
I don't give a *shit* what you're going through!
There's no need to use that kind of language.

[shouts]
Get out! Now!
Why are you here?
This is my apartment. I live here. Why are YOU here?

[about Montana]
She's got a lot of spirit.
She's a deranged bitch.
You people have the morals of guinney pigs!
What are you doing here?
This is my apartment, I live here, what are YOU doing here?
New boy in town?
Just got off the choo-choo... you have lovely eyes.
They're nothing compared to my tits! You should come up and see them sometime!
This is my husband, Bolt.
So, who dies? It can't be one of the regulars...
Not even Bolt?
Bolt? No, Bolt's gold, especially with that whole impotency thing coming up. One of the extras...
One of the homeless, David, one of the homeless.
That's cruel.
It's very cruel.

[after seeing Montana on the Enquirer, angry in tears]
Bitch!
[scene switch back and forth of Celeste, Lori, and Jeffrey in Edwards' office]
I never worked in an atmosphere like this before.
This whole pregnancy thing is a scam! I resent being treated like a leper!
Having to work with these two is a personal nightmare for me. I'm on the verge of a breakdown!
I'm on the verge of a nervous breakdown!
I could conceivably have a breakdown.
I mean, can you imagine what it's like having to face them on the set every single day?
It just seems to get harder and harder, even though I devoted my entire life to this show.

[walks back and forth lost for words]
Uh...
Mr. Edwards, it's them or me, that is the bottom line here. They go or I go!
This is the toughest decision I ever have to make, but I get paid 1.2 million dollars to make these kind of command decisions. So here it is...
[eats a cracker]
[Jeffrey is about to prepare the brain transplant]
MOTHER!
[Celeste sits up]
No, I can't let you do this!
She spoke?
She spoke!
Sudden speech, the last stages of brain fever! She can blow up any moment!
I can always speak! Mother...
She's MY mother!
MONTANA, SHUT UP!
